bgibbons.game.graphics

Class Colors

  • java.lang.Object
    • bgibbons.game.graphics.Colors

  • public class Colors
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to handle the colors to be used for the game.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Colors() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods

      Returns the color to be used for a given sprite for each of the four colors in the sprite.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Colors

        public Colors()

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public static int get(int color1,
                      int color2,
                      int color3,
                      int color4)
        Returns the color to be used for a given sprite for each of the four colors in the sprite.
        Parameters:
        color1 - A three digit number "rgb" where each digit ranges from 0 to 5 and is for the black color of the sprite, or -1 for the color not to be rendered.
        color2 - A three digit number "rgb" where each digit ranges from 0 to 5 and is for the dark grey color of the sprite, or -1 for the color not to be rendered.
        color3 - A three digit number "rgb" where each digit ranges from 0 to 5 and is for the light grey color of the sprite, or -1 for the color not to be rendered.
        color4 - A three digit number "rgb" where each digit ranges from 0 to 5 and is for the white color of the sprite, or -1 for the color not to be rendered.
        Returns:
        An integer value of the colors to be rendered sprite.

      • getRGB

        public static int[] getRGB(int color)
        Method to undo the get(int color1, int color2, int color3, int color4) method.
        Parameters:
        color - An int representing the color to be used for a given sprite for each of the four colors in the sprite.
        Returns:
        An array of three digit number's "rgb" where each digit ranges from 0 to 5, or -1 if the color was not to be rendered for black, dark grey, light grey, and white respectively.
